title: 112_s1093
content: The "Solar Uniting Neighborhoods (SUN) Act of 2011" clarifies the location of solar electric property. The "Solar Uniting Neighborhoods (SUN) Act of 2011" amends the definition of qualified solar electric property expenditure under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It specifies that the expenditure must be for property using solar energy to generate electricity for a dwelling unit in the United States or connected to the electrical grid within 50 miles of the residence. The SUN Act of 2011 amends the definition of qualified solar electric property expenditure under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It limits the credit for off-site solar property and allows for recapture of the credit if the property no longer meets the requirements. The SUN Act of 2011 amends the definition of qualified solar electric property expenditure under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It limits the credit for off-site solar property to $50,000 for any taxable year. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. CLARIFICATION REGARDING LOCATION OF SOLAR WATER HEATING PROPERTY. The amendment to Section 25D(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 clarifies that the term "off-site property" includes property not located on the same site as the dwelling unit using the energy generated, regardless of whether it displaces energy. The amendment clarifies that off-site property displacing energy for heating within 50 miles of the dwelling may qualify for a tax credit, with potential recapture by the Secretary. The amendment allows off-site solar property within 50 miles of a dwelling to qualify for a tax credit, with potential recapture by the Secretary. The tax credit for off-site solar property within 50 miles of a dwelling is capped at $50,000 per taxable year, effective for years after the enactment of the Act. The new section 139F excludes income from qualifying sales of solar electricity. The text discusses the exclusion of income from the sale of solar electricity to the electrical grid if generated by qualified solar electric property. It also includes technical and clerical amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The table of sections for part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by removing text following the item relating to section 139C and adding new items. The amendments made by this section include Indian health care benefits, free choice vouchers, income from qualifying sales of solar electricity, and cross references to other Acts. These amendments will apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
